docs.lead_paragraph: A C.D.C. study found that nearly a third of women of reproductive age had had an opioid painkiller prescription filled each year from 2008 to 2012, a practice that carries high risks for birth defects.

headline.main: High Rates of Opioid Prescriptions Among Women Raise Birth Defect Fears
headline.print_headline: High Rates of Opioid Prescriptions Among Women Raise Birth Defect Fears

docs.abstract: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention study finds that one-third of women ages 15-55 had an opioid painkiller prescription filled every year between 2008 and 2012; warn that practice holds a substantial risk of birth defects.
docs.snippet: A C.D.C. study found that nearly a third of women of reproductive age had had an opioid painkiller prescription filled each year from 2008 to 2012, a practice that carries high risks for birth defects.

keywords.value: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
keywords.name: organizations

docs.abstract: House Republican had planned to mark Thursday’s Roe v. Wade anniversary by pushing through a ban on almost all abortions 20 weeks after fertilization.

docs.lead_paragraph: Maryland's newly installed Republican governor wants to slam the brakes on spending growth and rely on fund transfers to close a gaping budget hole without raising taxes.

docs.lead_paragraph: Leaders of United and Southwest gave an upbeat forecast for 2015 that combined strong travel demand and cheaper fuel. Airline stocks soared on Thursday.

docs.lead_paragraph: Dressed in an open-collar shirt and blue suede shoes, Alexis Tsipras arrives at his party's headquarters for a live Q-and-A session on Twitter. The session is moderated by a leftwing newspaper that normally sells less than 2,000 copies a day. But Tsipras is reaching a much bigger audience: Foreign camera crews pack the tiny studio, and soon the hashtag #asktsipras is trending worldwide.

headline.main: Radical Left Political Outsiders Prepare for Power in Greece
headline.print_headline: Radical Left Political Outsiders Prepare for Power in Greece

docs.lead_paragraph: The U.S. House of Representatives passed a bill permanently barring federal funding of abortions on Thursday after Republican leaders dropped harsher anti-abortion legislation due to opposition from some of the party's moderate lawmakers.

headline.main: Abortion Debate Roils U.S. House on Roe v. Wade Anniversary
headline.print_headline: Abortion Debate Roils U.S. House on Roe v. Wade Anniversary

docs.lead_paragraph: Former U.S. Sen. and Kentucky Gov. Wendell Ford, an unapologetic smoker whose unfiltered chats and speeches endeared him to voters in a state that once thrived on tobacco and coal, has died at age 90.

headline.main: Wendell Ford, Ex-Kentucky Governor, US Senator, Dies at 90
headline.print_headline: Wendell Ford, Ex-Kentucky Governor, US Senator, Dies at 90
